Description.val:
The FY 2020 funding request was reduced by $22.000 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

The DDG Modernization Program is required to upgrade the in-service Flight I, II, and IIA DDG-51 Class ships in order to keep them relevant and affordable components of the Navy's Sea Power 21 Plan.  The DDG Modernization Program is composed of a series of improvements in both the Hull, Mechanical, and Electrical (HM&E) and Combat Systems (CS).  The modernization installations are planned for each ship at approximately the midlife point for each hull.  The quantity line represents the total DDG Modernization availabilities (HM&E and Combat Systems) started in each fiscal year.  HM&E: 6-5-4-3-4-4-4 Combat System: 2-2-3-2-3-3-4. 

The HM&E modernization will be comprised of the technologies transitioned from SCN funded DDG 111/112 and those additional improvements required to support the expected service life of the DDG 51 Class.  The upgrades will focus on technologies that reduce workload and Total Ownership Costs (TOC) for the remaining hull life of each ship.

The centerpiece of the CS modernization is the Aegis Weapon System (AWS) upgrade.  This upgrade will consist of the introduction of displays, computing equipment and the computer program required to implement Aegis Open Architecture (AOA) and replacement of the existing SPY-1D Signal Processor (SIGPRO) with the Multi-Mission Signal Processor.  Selected warfighting improvements will also be installed in conjunction with the combat systems upgrade.   This modernization program will provide a core modernization of the infrastructure "foundation" of each ship including the core engineering plan, core computing plan, and Combat Information Center (CIC).  This modernization program will also provide an infrastructure foundation that will function as a landing zone for future warfighting capabilities.

[P40A / DM002 - LAND BASED ENGINEERING SITES]: Funds will be used to upgrade shore facilities for HM&E alterations providing risk reduction testing and provide for Combat System and HM&E training products.

[P40A / DM013 - CONJUNCTIVE ALTERATION DEFINITION AND INTEGRATION]: Procures Conjunctive Alteration Definition and Integration that includes equipment procurement, non-recurring and recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

[P40A / HELO HANGER DOOR (HHD)]: Helo Hanger Door (HHD)- FLTIIA ships have documented HHD reliability issues.  This update installs several new reliability improvements that are planned for DDG113 AF.

[P40A / OFFICER OF THE DECK SCREEN (OOD)]: Officer Of The Deck Screen (OOD)- Replaces the Interior Communication/Standard Module alarm panels in the 3 OOD stations and Combat Systems Maintenance Center with Agimet Multi Function Color Repeaters for standardization of BF components and commonality with DDG105 AF design.

[P40A / AWS VIDEO DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM & CIRCUIT 3 TV]: This Ship Change replaces obsolete and unsupported legacy topside surveillance camera CKT-3TV Systems on NON-AMOD DDGs(including sensors, pan/tilt, unit, controllers and other HW) with shock and environmentally qualified COTS Camera System.

[P40A / DIGITAL VOLTAGE REGULATOR (DVR)]: Digital Voltage Regulator (DVR)- Replaces the obsolete legacy Excitation Control Panel (EXCOP) for each generator consistent with DDG 113AF.

[P40A / DM6IN - INSTALLATION]: Funds are for installation of DDG Modernization equipment in support of the Fleet Modernization Program.

[P40A / SOLID STATE RADAR]: Backfit a new gallium nitride antenna array and a multi-mission signal processor (MMSP).

[P40A / AEGIS MODERNIZATION TESTING (AMT)]: Provide on-site engineering and technical support of the planning and execution DDG Modernization availabilities. Provide engineering support in planning availability milestones, execute system and element testing requirements from AEGIS Light Off (ALO) to end of availability, support Combat Systems Alignment and Verification, provide crew training for maintaining newly installed AEGIS and legacy AEGIS equipment, and serve as the combat system engineering agent technical point of contact for combat system DDG Modernization matters.  AMT is a two-part event: Planning and Execution.  Planning consists of AMT test plan building, AMT schedule development and planning; AMT Execution consists of availability, support Combat Systems Alignment and Verification, provide crew training for maintaining newly installed AEGIS and legacy AEGIS equipment, and serve as the combat system engineering agent technical point of contract for combat system DDG Modernization matters.  AMT costs are dependent on the number, scope and complexity of AMT planned per Fiscal Year (FY) with funding spread over two years: AMT Planning is executed during the year of installation (~$5M) and AMT Execution is the year following (~$5M).

FY 2019 and FY 2020 costs are broken down as follows:

- FY 2019 AMT Planning: ($5M) to plan for two (2) AMT (FLT IIA combined HM&E and combat systems modernization).  Due to the FY19 $9.5M Congressional reduction, the two AMTs being planned were severely de-scoped.
- FY 2019 AMT Execution: ($5M) to execute two (2) AMT (FLT IIA combined HM&E and combat systems modernization).  Due to the FY19 Congressional reduction, the two AMTs being executed were severely de-scoped.  Due to a schedule change in execution, one of the two AMTs initially planned is now able to be fully executed.

- FY 2020 CSSQT Planning: ($15M) to plan three (3) AMTs (FLT IIA combined HM&E and combat systems modernization).  
- FY 2020 CSSQT Execution: ($10M) to execute two (2) AMTs (FLT IIA combined HM&E and combat systems modernization).

[P40A / COMBAT SYSTEM SHIP QUALIFICATION TRIALS (CSSQT)]: CSSQTs are required per Naval Sea Systems Instruction 90963.1C for all ships undergoing significant conversion/modernization availabilities.   CSSQTs are a two-part event: Planning and Execution.  Planning consists of CSSQT complex scenario building, CSSQT schedule development and planning; CSSQT Execution consists of a series of at-sea exercises and tests to verify/certify the newly installed DDG Modernization combat weapon systems have been installed properly and can be operated and maintained safely and effectively.  This is accomplished by assisting ship's force in achieving (1) a sustainable level of combat/weapon system operational readiness and (2) a maintainable level of material readiness. CSSQT consists of real-life threats utilizing aircraft flight services, Air Warfare/Surface Warfare/Under Sea Warfare range services and support, scenario data recording and data analysis. CSSQT costs are dependent on the number, scope and complexity of CSSQTs planned per Fiscal Year (FY) with funding spread over two years: CSSQT Planning is executed during the year of installation (~$1.5M) and CSSQT Execution is the year following (~$7.5M).

FY 2019 and FY 2020 costs are broken down as follows:

- FY 2019 CSSQT Planning: ($0M) the two (2) CSSQTs to be planned were cancelled due to the FY19 $9.0M Congressional reduction.
- FY 2019 CSSQT Execution: ($9M) to execute two (2) CSSQTs (FLT IIA combined HM&E and combat systems modernization).  Due to the FY19 Congressional reduction, the two CSSQTs being executed were severely de-scoped.  Due to a schedule change in execution, one of two CSSQTs initially planned will be able to be fully executed.

- FY 2020 CSSQT Planning: ($4.5M) to plan three (3) CSSQTs (FLT IIA combined HM&E and combat systems modernization).  
- FY 2020 CSSQT Execution: ($15.3M) to execute two (2) CSSQTs (FLT IIA combined HM&E and combat systems modernization).

[P40A / DM010 - FCS STAMO]: Procures Stabilized Master Oscillator (STAMO) combat systems that include equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

[P40A / DM012 - CEC]: Procures Cooperative Engagement Capability (CEC) combat systems that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships. Flight IIA DDGs have previously received CEC installation.

[P3A / DM001 - DDG MODERNIZATION HME (GEDMS)]: Gigabit Ethernet Data Multiplexing System (GEDMS) replaces the obsolete copper machinery control LAN infrastructure with a new system based on the widely used Ethernet industry standard.

[P3A - 2 / DM001 - DDG MODERNIZATION HME (MCS/DCS)]: Machinery Control System (MCS) replaces the obsolete control consoles while also delivering enhanced capability to the fleet through improved situational awareness and reconfigurable user stations.  The new consoles use Commercial Off The Shelf (COTS)-based computers which connect via Versa Modular Eurocard (VME)-chassis technology.  The VME architecture is expected to be supportable for the remaining service life of the ship and will enable computer upgrades within the chassis thereby mitigating future obsolescence concerns.

[P3A - 3 / DM001 - DDG MODERNIZATION HME (DVSS)]: Digital Video Surveillance System (DVSS) is a network of video cameras which are integrated into the Machinery Control system.  This system is primarily a watch-stander situational awareness tool which supplements the workload reduction benefits of the new MCS.

[P3A - 4 / DM001 - DDG MODERNIZATION HME (WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS)]: Shipwide Interior Wireless Communication System (SIWCS) - provides point-to-point coverage throughout the internal spaces of the ship as well as topside, topside-to-interior, line of sight ship-to-ship & line of sight ship-to-shore communications capabilities.

[P3A - 5 / DM001 - DDG MODERNIZATION HME (IBNS)]: The Integrated Bridge & Navigation System (IBNS) replaces obsolete bridge consoles and introduces flexibility with how the pilot house is managed during navigation.  The key benefit is the ability for operating with fewer watch-standers, reduced watch standard workloads, and improved safety of navigation.

[P3A - 6 / DM003 - MK 160 MOD 15 GWS]: Procures MK 160 Mod 15 Gun Weapon System (GWS) that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

[P3A - 7 / DM004 - AWS UPGRADE]: Procures equipment for the Aegis Weapon System (AWS) Upgrades that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

[P3A - 8 / DM005 - MULTI-MISSION SIGPRO]: Procures Multi-Mission SIGPRO combat systems that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

[P3A - 9 / DM006 - MULTI-MISSION SSA/CWI MICROWAVE TUBES]: Procures Multi-Mission Solid State Amplifier (SSA)/Continuous Wave Illumination (CWI) Microwave Tubes upgrades for DDG Modernization Program that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

[P3A - 10 / DM007 - SPY-1D TRANSMITTER UPGRADES]: Procures SPY-1D Transmitter Upgrades combat systems that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

[P3A - 11 / DM008 - MULTI-MISSION BMD CAPABILITY]: Procures Multi-Mission Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD) Capability combat systems that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

[P3A - 12 / DM009 - VLS UPGRADES]: Procures Vertical Launch System (VLS) Modifications, Evolved Sea Sparrow Missile VLS Modifications, SM3 Operability Heating Ventilation Air Conditioning (HVAC) and VLS MODS for SM3 Block 3 combat systems that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

[P3A - 13 / DM011 - AN/SQQ-89 A(V15)]: Procures improved AN/SQQ-89(V)15 with Multi-Function Towed Array (MFTA) combat systems to replace the installed MIL-STD AN/SQQ-89(V) that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

Name.@footnote: Funds are used to upgrade shore facilities utilized for pre-installation testing and crew training of HM&E and Combat Systems alterations.

Name.val: 2) DM013 - CONJUNCTIVE ALTERATION DEFINITION AND INTEGRATION
2.1) DM013 - CONJUNCTIVE ALTERATION DEFINITION AND INTEGRATION
4.1) OFFICER OF THE DECK SCREEN (OOD) EQUIPMENT

8) DMCA3 - COMMUNICATIONS UPGRADE FOR DDG MOD CONGRESSIONAL ADD
9) DMCA4 - SMART VALVE AUTOMATIC FIRE SUPPRESSION SYSTEM CONGRESSIONAL ADD

Congressional Add for-Bromine-free Water Purification Systems. Until recently, most onboard ship water purification systems used bromine as an antimicrobial. However, bromine is toxic and requires special hazardous material [HAZMAT] handling which is time consuming and expensive. While the Navy has placed bromine-free systems on most of the large-deck surface ship classes, it has not yet removed bromine systems from the Littoral Combat Ship, Ticonderoga class cruisers, destroyers or frigates.
Name.val: 16) DMCA5-BROMINE-FREE WATER PURIFICATION SYSTEM CONGRESSIONAL ADD

Name.@footnote: Procures Stabilized Master Oscillator (STAMO) combat systems that include equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

Procures Cooperative Engagement Capability (CEC) combat systems that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships. Flight IIA DDGs have previously received CEC installation.

Engineering Services line includes both Flight I/II and Flight IIA ships.  Installation costs across the FYDP vary depending on current port rates - avails not designated with a specific execution port (TBD) have a generic rate for budgeting, and install costs will be updated once an execution port is assigned. Port rates are updated every year by CNRMC based on the forecasted port loading model. Port loading rate forecasts are the rates recommended for all budgeted maintenance and organic modernization within a specific port.  Individual ship's availability durations vary dependent upon the integration of ship's maintenance and modernization work packages.   Installation funding for a ship is divided over a three-year period.  Installation execution funding in the year of availability, and Design Service Allocation (DSA) two years prior to availability, and DSA in the year prior to the availability.  This includes ship checks, ship installation drawing (SID) development, logistic document development and long lead time material procurements (LLTM).
Due to ship specific differences, the unit cost for a Flight IIA ship is less than that for a Flight I/II ship.  DDG 111 & 112 received GEDMS during new construction.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: GEDMS EQUIPMENT FLIGHT IIA

Description.val:
Gigabit Ethernet Data Multiplexing System (GEDMS) replaces the obsolete copper machinery control LAN infrastructure with a new system based on the widely used Ethernet industry standard. 

Engineering Services:

Production Support Services are phased over a three (3) year span starting two (2) years prior to installation on a per hull basis.  It includes five (5) elements that are related to the production and delivery of a usable end-item:  Production Engineering, Quality Assurance, Product Improvement, Acceptance Test and Evaluation, and Contractor Engineering and Technical Services (CETS). Due to the phasing of the requirement over a three year period, engineering services will fluctuate depending on the number of ships in each year.

Five (5) elements and approximate breakdown is as follows:

Production Engineering includes preparation, test and technical evaluation of engineering changes to correct deficiencies in the production items; production configuration control; review and evaluation of production design data and documentation; and logistic supportability efforts.

Quality Assurance includes the preparation of procedures and the conduct of inspections, examinations and test during production that are necessary to deliver an item of the required quality as specified by the terms of the contract.

Product Improvement includes improving reliability/maintainability/availability, and the correction of deficiencies exclusive of contractual specifications.

Acceptance Test and Evaluation of a production item includes preparation of test plans, testing, data analysis, and data evaluation.

Contractor Engineering and Technical Services (CETS) includes the furnishing of advice, instruction, and training by commercial or industrial companies.

Name.@footnote: Installation costs across the FYDP vary depending on current port rates - avails not designated with a specific execution port (TBD) have a generic rate for budgeting, and install costs will be updated once an execution port is assigned. Port rates are updated every year by CNRMC based on the forecasted port loading model. Port loading rate forecasts are the rates recommended for all budgeted maintenance and organic modernization within a specific port.  Individual ship's availability durations vary dependent upon the integration of ship's maintenance and modernization work packages.   Installation funding for a ship is divided over a three-year period.  Installation execution funding in the year of availability, and Design Service Allocation (DSA) two years prior to availability, and DSA in the year prior to the availability.  This includes ship checks, ship installation drawing (SID) development, logistic document development and long lead time material procurements (LLTM).

Installation funding for a ship is divided over a three-year period.  Installation execution funding in the year of availability, and Design Service Allocation (DSA) two years prior to availability, and DSA in the year prior to the availability.  This includes ship checks, ship installation drawing (SID) development, logistic document development and long lead time material procurements (LLTM).

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: MULTI-MISSION SIGPRO EQUIPMENT

Description.val:
Procures Multi-Mission SIGPRO combat systems that includes equipment procurement, recurring engineering, equipment integration and Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) products for DDG 51 Class ships.

Engineering Services:

Production Support Services are phased over a three (3) year span starting two (2) years prior to installation on a per hull basis.  It includes five (5) elements that are related to the production and delivery of a usable end-item:  Production Engineering, Quality Assurance, Product Improvement, Acceptance Test and Evaluation, and Contractor Engineering and Technical Services (CETS). Due to the phasing of the requirement over a three year period, engineering services will fluctuate depending on the number of ships in each year.

Five (5) elements and approximate breakdown is as follows:

Production Engineering includes preparation, test and technical evaluation of engineering changes to correct deficiencies in the production items; production configuration control; review and evaluation of production design data and documentation; and logistic supportability efforts.

Quality Assurance includes the preparation of procedures and the conduct of inspections, examinations and test during production that are necessary to deliver an item of the required quality as specified by the terms of the contract.

Product Improvement includes improving reliability/maintainability/availability, and the correction of deficiencies exclusive of contractual specifications.

Acceptance Test and Evaluation of a production item includes preparation of test plans, testing, data analysis, and data evaluation.

Contractor Engineering and Technical Services (CETS) includes the furnishing of advice, instruction, and training by commercial or industrial companies.

Name.@footnote: Installation costs for this equipment are captured in P40A/DM6IN-Installation.

Description.val:
Procures the Dynalec Integrated Announcing System (DIAS) that replaces the ship's existing obsolete and unreliable general announcing system, that enables key control stations to publish critical information to the ship by voice.
Integrated Logistics Support includes development of ILS documentation, review and certification.  Environmental Quality Testing includes Shock, Vibration and EMI certification to ensure DIAS  meets survivability requirements.
